sentences.en: a face-off between the presidential candidates
sentences.cn: 总统候选人之间的辩论

sentences.en: A national poll shows the presidential race in a dead heat.
sentences.cn: 一项全国民意调查显示总统竞选相持不下。

sentences.en: Bradley has been considered a possible presidential contender himself.
sentences.cn: 布拉德利本人就被认为是总统职位的有力竞争者。

sentences.en: He declined to give any information on the Presidential election.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝透露任何有关总统选举的消息。

sentences.en: He recently did the catering for a presidential reception.
sentences.cn: 他最近承办了一次总统招待会的宴席。

sentences.en: He recounted how heavily armed soldiers forced him from the presidential palace.
sentences.cn: 他讲述了自己是怎样被全副武装的士兵从总统官邸里赶出来的。

sentences.en: He was granted a presidential pardon.
He was relieved of his duties as presidential adviser.
sentences.cn: 他被撤销了总统顾问一职。

sentences.en: He won last month's presidential election by a landslide.
sentences.cn: 他以压倒性多数赢得上月的总统选举。

sentences.en: Jackson had been a major power-broker in the 1988 Presidential elections.
sentences.cn: 杰克逊是1988年总统选举中举足轻重的权力经纪人。

sentences.en: Neither of the front-runners in the presidential election is a mainstream politician.
sentences.cn: 总统选举中的两位领先者都不是主流政治家。

sentences.en: Presidential elections are due to be held in ten days' time.
sentences.cn: 总统竞选将在10天后如期举行。

sentences.en: Safire writes hilariously of being banished from presidential favor.
sentences.cn: 萨菲尔笔锋幽默，描写了自己没能博取总统好感的事。

sentences.en: The presidential candidates are on the stump today.
sentences.cn: 总统候选人今天在作巡回演说。

words.tran_cn: 总统（或董事长、会长、大学校长等）的职位（任期）；管辖；支配

trans.tran_cn: 总统[总裁，议长，董事长，校长等]（职务）的，统辖的，支配的，监督的，指挥的，总统制的，有总统气派的
